author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Weaken As Emerging Fed View Pushes 30-Year Yield Above 3%
text:
Investors sold U.S. government bonds Thursday, sending the yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note to its biggest one-day gain in three weeks.
The yield on the 10-year note rose to 2.773%, from 2.722% Wednesday, its highest closing level since April 3, 2014. Yields rise as bond prices fall. The yield on the 30-year bond climbed above 3% to its highest level since May 15, closing at 3.005% from 2.944%.
